dialogues.text: Startled, REACTING. He sets his feet, leans back against back wall of the ladder well, brings the shotgun up, puts the muzzle against the kickboard, clicks off the safety.

dialogues.speaker: BOOK
dialogues.text: We HEAR with him the thump of the muzzle, the CLICK... an with marvelous speed, Book pulls the kickboard and drops to the floor. McELROY В– FLASH CUT Staring in, stun-eyed, already falli forward (having leaned his weight on the shotgun) as Book seizes the shotgun by the barrel, pulls inward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As McElroy pitches forward through the opening, SCREAMS a GRABS as he plunges past Book. The shotgun FIRES as McElr manages to hold onto Book, and both men plunge thirty fee to the bottom of the silo.

dialogues.speaker: BOOK
dialogues.text: He falls almost straight down, lands on his back, lies  stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MCELROY
dialogues.text: His forward motion has carried him across the silo. His h bounds off the white brick wall about five feet up... and falls in a heap, blood gushing from his head, as...

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON BOOK
dialogues.text: Blinking, groaning, just beginning to stir... and, sudden into the frame comes a hand with a pistol in it. The muzz is placed firmly against Book's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schaeffer holding the pistol. He cocks the pistol, tenses if to FIRE (and he is actually about to)... when there is SOUND behind him. He snaps around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Stoltzfus and Samuel standing in the kickboard openin (Schaeffer having kicked the kickboard in when he heard t shot from within the silo). They stand solemnly, looking as:

dialogues.speaker: SCHAEFFER
dialogues.text: He eases the hammer down on this pistol, speaks softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Johnny. On your feet.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCENE
dialogues.text: As Book struggles to his feet В– Schaeffer holding the pi tight to Book's head. Book turns, sees Samuel and Stoltzf blinks. Schaeffer shoves Book toward the opening. As Book moves t Samuel, he speaks quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Book and McElroy move out of the silo, down the passag toward the milkhouse, Stoltzfus and Sam (after a glance i at the inert McElroy) follow and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As first Stoltzfus and Samuel, then Book and Schaeffer em into the barnyard. Schaeffer has the muzzle of his pistol pressed firmly against Book's throat, just below his jaw. Schaeffer pulls up, frowning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Amishmen gathered В– the Stoltzfus family, the Hochst brothers, et al. All staring hard at Schaeffer and Book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a high wide angle the final scene is played out.  Schaeffer and Book, now moving again slowly up the drive, the Amish following along closely on both sides.

dialogues.speaker: BOOK
dialogues.text: As Schaeffer prods Book forward, warily eyeing the Amish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back, you people! (prodding) Keep moving, Johnny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book takes a couple of steps further, then abruptly stops The Amish stand about close, staring, no one moving. Book now slowly turns his head, looks at Schaeffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to do it right  here, Schaeffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try me, Johnny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli steps forward, bloody cloth held to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... will you kill us all, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Schaeffer's eyes waver between Book and Eli, Book slow turns until he is facing Schaeffer... the gun now leveled and almost pressing against В– Book's chest. Book locks e with Schaeffer. Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all over, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move! Or you die right here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book's right hand snakes out, grabs Schaeffer by the gunh wrist, twists viciously, Schaeffer SCREAMS in pain, the g falls out of his hand, he starts to his knees under the f of Book's grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Book bends, picks up the pistol, releases Schaeffer, p him away. Schaeffer staggers against Hochstetler, who В– to keep him from falling, and partly (it appears) to  congratulate him on his surrender В– wraps one brawny arm around Schaeffer's shoulders, gives him a short approving nod... holds Schaeffer as:

dialogues.speaker: BOOK
dialogues.text: Turning, looking into the crowd, finding Rachel. Their ga meet, hold for a long MOMENT. In the eyes of both we read resignation... whatever there was between them has been  terribly damaged. It is almost certainly over for them, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH SHOT holding the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Book steps out, looking somehow strang in his working suit. He looks about him, sees Samuel down the pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eases down beside Samuel. They both stare into the pon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really ever coming back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to, Sam. You and I are going to  a courthouse together, put some people  behind bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got your gun on now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure have, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam grins. Book takes him in his arms, holds him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book opens the door of the car, turns to find Rachel stan there with his Amish hat in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to take this... to remember  by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my baggy pants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Whenever you want them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to kiss her, but does not. Their eyes say it all Eli has a final word, SHOUTING from the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be careful, John Book! Out among  them English!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book gets quickly into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Book drives, he sees an open buggy coming down the hil toward the farm, He slows as he passes, It's Daniel  Hochstetler. A long beat, and as they pass, Hochstetler g Book an expansive tip of his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book turns to look back at his rival, a doubt in his eyes FREEZE FRAME.
